title: Jio Financial, 12 other stocks to trade ex-dividend on Monday. Do you own?
summary: Shares of Jio Financial Services and several other companies are in focus today as August 8 marks the ex-dividend date. Investors must buy shares by today to qualify for dividends declared by firms like Akzo Nobel India, Castrol India, Kalyani Steels, and more.
fullContent: Shares of Jio Financial Services and several other companies are in focus today as August 8 marks the ex-dividend date. Investors must buy shares by today to qualify for dividends declared by firms like Akzo Nobel India, Castrol India, Kalyani Steels, and more. Dividend-paying stocks are likely to see heightened trading activity as the record date approaches on August 11.

title: Zepto expands into online pharmacy, promises 10-minute medicine delivery

title: AU Small Finance Bank shares zoom over 7% after RBI nod for universal bank transition
summary: AU Small Finance Bank's shares surged after the Reserve Bank of India granted in-principle approval for its transition to a Universal Bank. This makes AU the first Small Finance Bank in India to receive such approval, reflecting its strong performance and commitment to...
fullContent: AU Small Finance Bank's shares surged after the Reserve Bank of India granted in-principle approval for its transition to a Universal Bank. This makes AU the first Small Finance Bank in India to receive such approval, reflecting its strong performance and commitment to financial inclusion. The transition aligns with AU’s goal of becoming a full-service bank.

title: Trump's 50% tariffs: Textiles, jewellery, and seafood exports brace for a massive impact
summary: Industry experts warn that the tariffs will hit India’s labour-intensive export sectors — such as textiles, leather, jewellery, and marine products like shrimp — the hardest. These sectors, largely driven by MSMEs, may find it difficult to absorb the sudden cost shock.
fullContent: Industry experts warn that the tariffs will hit India’s labour-intensive export sectors — such as textiles, leather, jewellery, and marine products like shrimp — the hardest. These sectors, largely driven by MSMEs, may find it difficult to absorb the sudden cost shock.

title: Indonesia’s Benchmark Yield Falls to Lowest in Almost Two Years
summary: Indonesia’s 10-year bond yield fell to the lowest level since September 2023 due to rising interest-rate cuts expectations, overseas inflows and a soft US dollar.
fullContent: Indonesia’s 10-year bond yield fell to the lowest level since September 2023 due to rising interest-rate cuts expectations, overseas inflows and a soft US dollar.

title: BSE shares drop over 2% after Q1 results as brokerages downgrade stock, trim target price
summary: BSE shares: The exchange reported a 103% YoY jump in consolidated net profit to ₹539 crore for the June quarter, up from ₹265 crore last year. Revenue from operations also surged 59% YoY to ₹958 crore.

title: Hongkongers aged 18 to 49 with chronic illnesses to receive subsidised flu jabs
summary: Hong Kong residents aged 18 to 49 who have chronic illnesses can receive a subsidised flu jab later this year under health authorities' plan to expand the city’s vaccination programme, the Post has learned.
fullContent: Hong Kong residents aged 18 to 49 who have chronic illnesses can receive a subsidised flu jab later this year under health authorities' plan to expand the city’s vaccination programme, the Post has learned. The new move would help to identify the city’s hidden population with chronic illnesses and provide them with stronger community healthcare support services, according to a government source on Friday. “Apart from encouraging more people to get vaccinated against the flu, the expansion will...
